Package coreapi

Interface Order

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OrderImpl
    public interface Order

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int checkProductQuantity​(int id)
      Returns how much of a certain product is contained within this order.
      boolean containsProduct​(int id)
      Returns whether or not the product passed as parameter is contained in this order or not.
      java.util.Map<Product,​java.lang.Integer> getBasket()
      Returns a map containing the products contained in this order, and how many of each of them is stored.
      java.util.Date getDate()
      Returns the timestamp representing the date when the order was created.
      int getId()
      Returns the unique Id assigned to this order.
      java.util.List<Product> getProducts()
      Returns a read-only list of the products contained in this order.
      OrderStatus getStatus()
      Returns the constant corresponding to the current state of the order, as determined by the Enum OrderStatus.
      java.math.BigDecimal totalCost()
      Returns the combined cost of the whole order.

    • Method Detail

      • totalCost

        java.math.BigDecimal totalCost()
        Returns the combined cost of the whole order. Takes into account which products comprised the order, and how many of each of them.
        Returns:
        the cost of the order.
        See Also:
        BigDecimal

      • getId

        int getId()
        Returns the unique Id assigned to this order. Each Order has a unique identifier within the system. Two different orders cannot have the same id at any time.
        Returns:
        the order Id.
        See Also:
        OrderFactory

      • getDate

        java.util.Date getDate()
        Returns the timestamp representing the date when the order was created.
        Returns:
        timestamp from the creation of the order
        See Also:
        Date

      • getStatus

        OrderStatus getStatus()
        Returns the constant corresponding to the current state of the order, as determined by the Enum OrderStatus.
        Returns:
        the current state of the order.
        See Also:
        OrderStatus

      • getProducts

        java.util.List<Product> getProducts()
        Returns a read-only list of the products contained in this order. The list does NOT contain how many of each product is contained within the order.
        Returns:
        the list of products in this order.
        See Also:
        List, Product

      • getBasket

        java.util.Map<Product,​java.lang.Integer> getBasket()
        Returns a map containing the products contained in this order, and how many of each of them is stored.
        Returns:
        the map containing the quantity of each product in the order
        See Also:
        Map

      • checkProductQuantity

        int checkProductQuantity​(int id)
        Returns how much of a certain product is contained within this order. If the product isn't contained in this order, the return value is zero.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the product to check.
        Returns:
        the amount of a certain product in this order.

      • containsProduct

        boolean containsProduct​(int id)
        Returns whether or not the product passed as parameter is contained in this order or not. The return value is true if there is at least 1 unit of the product in this order, and false if there is none.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the product to check.
        Returns:
        true if the order contains the specified product.
